com.karacasoft.cardboardui

Class CardboardUIActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.karacasoft.cardboardui.CardboardUIActivity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MainActivity

    public class CardboardUIActivity
extends java.lang.Object
    Main component of the UI for Cardboard API.

    You can think of this as the Canvas of your application.

    It has a very simple lifecycle inside. The View3D objects you add will be updated first. (via View3D.update()). Then they will be drawn with their View3D.draw(Eye) method.

    You have to use @link ViewContent to add your views to your "canvas". Here's a simple view initialization inside a CardboardUIActivity:

    TextView3D txt = new TextView3D(this, "Text, test");
    ViewContent content = new ViewContent(this);

    content.addView(txt);
    this.setCurrentContent(content);

    Check MainActivity.

    See Also:
    View3D, ViewContent
